title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHICAGO — On a night where offense was a precious commodity, Michael Jordan authored a defensive masterpiece for the ages. The Chicago Bulls’ 97-69 dismantling of the Atlanta Hawks was not defined by a scoring explosion, but by His Airness’s relentless and suffocating defensive will, which held the entire Hawks roster to a staggering total of 69 points.

While Scottie Pippen led all scorers with a modest 20 points, the story was etched in Jordan’s stat line: a game-high 4 steals that fueled the Bulls’ transition attack and demoralized Atlanta at every turn. In a contest where points were hard-earned, Jordan’s defense became the most potent weapon on the floor.

The Bulls’ defense, spearheaded by Jordan, was historically oppressive. They held the Hawks to a collective 30 points in the entire second half, turning a competitive game into a rout. Atlanta’s leading scorer, Steve Smith, was held to just 16 points, a testament to the defensive clamps applied by the Bulls, particularly from their leader.

This was a victory carved from grit and determination, a classic example of the Bulls’ championship DNA. On a night when the offense wasn't fluid, they proved they could win with sheer defensive force. And as he so often did, Michael Jordan set the tone, reminding the league that dominance isn't always measured in points, but sometimes in the complete and utter shutdown of an opponent. The path to victory was paved with defensive stops, and no one was more disruptive than Number 23.
